campaign.name: Night of the Zealot
campaign.description: The core set campaign. Introduces players to Arkham Horror LCG mechanics through three scenarios of escalating difficulty.

scenarios.name: The Gathering

enemies.name: Ghoul Priest
enemies.notes: Boss enemy. Can be parlayed with if Lita is in play. High priority target.

enemies.name: Swarm of Rats
enemies.notes: Weak but annoying. Easy to defeat.

treacheries.name: Rotting Remains
treacheries.notes: Core willpower test. Fail = horror damage.

treacheries.name: Frozen in Fear
treacheries.notes: Attach. Costs actions to discard. High priority.

treacheries.name: Dissonant Voices
treacheries.notes: Cannot play cards until end of round.

treacheries.name: Ancient Evils
treacheries.notes: Add doom to agenda. Cannot be canceled.

tips: Prioritize willpower icons for treachery protection
Bring combat options for the Ghoul Priest boss
Consider keeping Lita Chantler alive for parley option
Horror soak is valuable - many treacheries deal horror
The scenario is forgiving for new players - good for testing decks
scenarios.difficulty_notes: Introductory scenario. Low enemy count, straightforward objectives.

scenarios.name: The Midnight Masks

enemies.name: Acolyte
enemies.notes: Adds doom when spawns. Priority target.

enemies.name: Wizard of the Order
enemies.notes: Elite cultist. Retaliate. Must defeat to interrogate.

enemies.name: Masked Hunter
enemies.notes: Aloof. Hunter. One of six unique cultists.

enemies.name: Ruth Turner
enemies.notes: Aloof. Hard to pin down. Parley target.

tips: This is a timed scenario - doom pressure is real
Focus on interrogating cultists efficiently
Not all cultists need to be found - prioritize based on time
Movement efficiency matters - locations spread across Arkham
Consider resign timing - better to escape with some info than none
Ward of Protection is excellent against doom treacheries
Cards that provide extra actions help cover ground
scenarios.difficulty_notes: Time pressure scenario. Success measured by cultists interrogated. Very replayable.

scenarios.name: The Devourer Below

enemies.name: Umordhoth
enemies.notes: Final boss. Massive. Consider alternate win conditions.

treacheries.name: Grasping Hands
treacheries.notes: Fail = damage equal to failure amount.

treacheries.name: Offer of Power
treacheries.notes: High difficulty. Adds doom on failure.

treacheries.name: Dreams of R'lyeh
treacheries.notes: Horror damage. Discard cards from hand on failure.

tips: This is the hardest scenario in the campaign
Strong willpower is essential - multiple high-difficulty tests
Combat capability needed for the boss encounter
Horror protection is critical - many sources of horror
Consider bringing damage assets that can scale (Dynamite, etc.)
Alternative win condition exists - may not need to defeat Umordhoth
Managing doom is crucial - vengeance enemies accelerate agenda
Bring soak (allies, armor) for the brutal encounter deck
scenarios.difficulty_notes: Campaign finale. High difficulty spike. Boss has multiple paths to resolution.
